title: Translating the statement
text: The statement tell us that if $$x$$ is closer than delta to $$2$$ and $$x$$ is not equal to $$2$$, then f(x) is closer to than $$1$$ to $$2$$.

, then f(x) is closer to than   1

title: Visualizing
text: In essence, we are asked to find how close to $$2$$ must $$x$$ be, if $$y$$ is within $$1$$ unit of $$2$$ on the graph. We can find this by drawing boundary lines on the graph that fulfill these conditions and making delta the distance from $$x=2$$ to the closer of the two $$x-boundary$$ lines.

We can find this by drawing boundary lines on the graph that fulfill these conditions and making delta the distance from  x is equal to, 2  to the closer of the two  x, minus boundary  lines.
